content.body: Yeah, thanks. I’d spotted it. My current implementation has no caching anywhere so passes that subtest (but is painfully slow). I’m not sure I particularly care until it shows up in a profile. It’s correct and, apart from that subtest, matches the spec and other browsers’ behaviour.
I hadn’t considered caching the query, before I saw that issue. So it’s another optimisation to do one day (if it shows up).

Piers Wombwell: also, for the participation agreement, you'll likely have to make your membership in the ekioh GitHub organization public, for the checker to realize you're associated with that entity. You could do so in https://github.com/orgs/ekioh/people.
content.formatted_body: Piers Wombwell: also, for the participation agreement, you'll likely have to make your membership in the ekioh GitHub organization public, for the checker to realize you're associated with that entity. You could do so in https://github.com/orgs/ekioh/people.

content.body: Ah yes, thanks. Should be okay now.
content.formatted_body: Ah yes, thanks. Should be okay now.

content.body: Hi Yoav Weiss: Chrome 89 added support for User Agent Client hints - see https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5995832180473856 . This appears to omit `Sec-CH-UA-Bitness` based on quick scan and fact it is not in the demo. Is that correct, and if so, is it planned?
content.formatted_body: Hi Yoav Weiss: Chrome 89 added support for User Agent Client hints - see https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5995832180473856 . This appears to omit Sec-CH-UA-Bitness based on quick scan and fact it is not in the demo. Is that correct, and if so, is it planned?

content.body: * PS https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data/pull/11235 is where this is being added to MDN browser compatibility.

content.body: Bitness is being added in M93, IIRC
